title: Segmentation fault (address boundary error) when optimizations off
body:
I think this shell session sums it up:

```
[20:42:21] me@my-box /project/path (0) 
> target/debug/program
fish: “target/debug/program” terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)
[20:42:24] me@my-box /project/path (139) 
> target/release/program

Rust panicked.
[20:42:27] me@my-box /project/path (127) 
>
```

There's obviously something else wrong with my program (thus the panic (I've had to override the panic handler for... reasons)), but that's not Rust's fault.

I also used `gdb` to take a look at what's going on and found this around the point of the crash with `disassemble`:

```
   0x0000555555557ce6 <+134>:   xorps  %xmm0,%xmm0
   0x0000555555557ce9 <+137>:   movups %xmm0,0x12c(%rsp)
=> 0x0000555555557cf1 <+145>:   movaps %xmm0,0x120(%rsp)
   0x0000555555557cf9 <+153>:   movaps %xmm0,0x110(%rsp)
   0x0000555555557d01 <+161>:   movaps %xmm0,0x100(%rsp)
   0x0000555555557d09 <+169>:   movaps %xmm0,0xf0(%rsp)
   0x0000555555557d11 <+177>:   movaps %xmm0,0xe0(%rsp)
   0x0000555555557d19 <+185>:   movaps %xmm0,0xd0(%rsp)
```

With the `release` build (optimizations enabled), `disassemble` shows:

```
   0x000055555555534f <+63>:    xorps  %xmm0,%xmm0
   0x0000555555555352 <+66>:    movups %xmm0,0x116(%rsp)
   0x000055555555535a <+74>:    movups %xmm0,0x10a(%rsp)
=> 0x0000555555555362 <+82>:    movups %xmm0,0xfa(%rsp)
   0x000055555555536a <+90>:    movups %xmm0,0xea(%rsp)
   0x0000555555555372 <+98>:    movups %xmm0,0xda(%rsp)
   0x000055555555537a <+106>:   movups %xmm0,0xca(%rsp)
   0x0000555555555382 <+114>:   movups %xmm0,0xba(%rsp)
```

Note that the instruction pointer has passed the point of the panic in the `debug` build.

If necessary, I can provide full source (or more disassemblies), but the relevant section is:

```rust
let mut addr: lens_syscalls::sockaddr_un = lens_syscalls::sockaddr_un{sun_family: 1, sun_path: [0; 108]};
```

I wrote `lens_syscalls` myself. The relevant struct declaration (based on `struct sockaddr_un` from the Linux man pages) is:

```rust
#[repr(C)]
pub struct sockaddr_un {
  pub sun_family: u16,
  pub sun_path: [u8; 108],
}
```

Version:

```
rustc 1.35.0-nightly (7c19e1eed 2019-03-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7c19e1eed5418b8c02be65d678417b241ee01a3e
commit-date: 2019-03-12
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.35.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```
